source:
%%pyspark

matchs_names = [
  'Year',
  'Date',
  'Time',
  'Round',
  'Stadium',
  'City',
  'Country',
  'HomeTeam',
  'HomeGoals',
  'AwayGoals',
  'AwayTeam',
  'Observation'
]


# dfwcup = spark.read.load('abfss://demo@myec44datalake.dfs.core.windows.net/AWS/world_cup_match.csv', format='text')
dfwcup = spark.read.csv('abfss://demo@myec44datalake.dfs.core.windows.net/AWS/world_cup_match.csv', header=True, inferSchema=True)
dfwcup = dfwcup.toDF(*matchs_names)

dftest=dfwcup.drop('Observation')
dftest.show(10)

spark.sql("CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS mydemo")
dftest.write.saveAsTable("mydemo.wordcupmatch")


##(dftest.write
##    .mode('overwrite')
##    .save('abfss://demo@myec44datalake.dfs.core.windows.net/AWS/world_cup_match_new.csv')
